contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Donari'''|土成町|Donari-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Itano District, Tokushima|Itano District]], [[Tokushima Prefecture|Tokushima]], [[Japan]]. On April 1, 2005 Donari was merged with the towns of [[Awa, Tokushima|Awa]] (old) and [[Ichiba, Tokushima|Ichiba]], both from [[Awa District, Tokushima|Awa District]], and the town of [[Yoshino, Tokushima|Yoshino]], also from [[Itano District, Tokushima|Itano District]], to form the new city of [[Awa, Tokushima|Awa]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,255 and a [[population density|density]] of 145.82 persons per km². The total area was 56.61 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.awa.lg.jp/ Awa official website] (in Japanese) [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Tokushima Prefecture]] {{Tokushima-geo-stub}}
